title: Does Leading at Halftime Predict Winning in Big Ten Men’s College Basketball?
text:
FILL IN WORDS HERE YAY!!


Code
library(tidyverse)

basketball <- read_csv("Project 1 Data - Sheet1.csv")

big <- basketball |>
  filter(HalftimeStatus == "Winning") |> 
 group_by(Team, Result) |>
  summarise(total_games = n())

ggplot() + 
  geom_bar(data=big, aes(x=reorder(Team, total_games), weight = total_games, fill=Result)) + 
  coord_flip() +
  labs(
    x="", 
    y="Number of Games", 
    title="Leading at Half Pays Off in the Big Ten", 
    subtitle="Teams like Michigan State, Wisconsin and Maryland often convert halftime leads into \nvictories. Meanwhile, Nebraska, rarely finds itself ahead at the break.", 
    caption="Source: Sports Reference | By Avery Linder"
    ) +
  scale_fill_manual(values=c("#939598", "#0088CE")) + 
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(
    plot.title.position = "plot",
    plot.title = element_text(size = 20, face = "bold"),
    plot.subtitle = element_text(size=10),
    axis.title = element_text(size = 9), 
  )
